etymology.description: 不得 (cannot; must not) + 了 (liǎo ‘to manage/finish’) = beyond handling; extremely serious/intense.
etymology.interpretation: Originally conveys something too severe to cope with, hence ‘terrible; disastrous’. In modern use it also functions as an intensifier after adjectives/verbs meaning ‘extremely’, and as an exclamation can mean ‘amazing’ depending on context.

parts.english: finish; settle; understand; be able to

examples.chinese: 外面热得不得了(外面熱得不得了)。
这下不得了了(這下不得了了)。
她高兴得不得了(她高興得不得了)。
